Doc: A type that specifies the source for and timing of a fixing of an exchange rate. This is used in the agreement of non-deliverable forward trades as well as various types of FX OTC options that require observations against a particular rate.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A type that specifies the source for and timing of a fixing of an exchange rate. This is used in the agreement of non-deliverable forward trades as well as various types of FX OTC options that require observations against a particular rate.
 #/
record FpML5.confirmation.FxFixing {
  # Defines the two currencies for an FX trade and the quotation relationship between the two currencies.
  quotedCurrencyPair : FpML5.confirmation.QuotedCurrencyPair

  # Describes the specific date when a non-deliverable forward or cash-settled option will "fix" against a particular rate, which will be used to compute the ultimate cash settlement. This element should be omitted where a single, discrete fixing date cannot be identified e.g. on an american option, where fixing may occur at any date on a continuous range.
  fixingDate : date?

  # Specifies the methodology (reference source and, optionally, fixing time) to be used for determining a currency conversion rate.
  fxSpotRateSource : FpML5.confirmation.FxSpotRateSource?

}

quotedCurrencyPair.Doc: Defines the two currencies for an FX trade and the quotation relationship between the two currencies.
quotedCurrencyPair.Name: quotedCurrencyPair

fixingDate.Doc: Describes the specific date when a non-deliverable forward or cash-settled option will "fix" against a particular rate, which will be used to compute the ultimate cash settlement. This element should be omitted where a single, discrete fixing date cannot be identified e.g. on an american option, where fixing may occur at any date on a continuous range.
fixingDate.Name: fixingDate

fxSpotRateSource.Doc: Specifies the methodology (reference source and, optionally, fixing time) to be used for determining a currency conversion rate.
fxSpotRateSource.Name: fxSpotRateSource
